basics.name: Rui Chen
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: Computer Science student at the University of Hawaiʻi with hands-on experience building and maintaining production web systems, developing RESTful APIs, and validating system correctness. Interested in software engineering, testing, and reliable systems.

work.company: University of Hawaiʻi Information Technology Services
work.summary: Full-stack developer for UH Groupings, a university-wide group and access management system.
highlights: Built and maintained full-stack web features using AngularJS, React, Next.js, and Spring Boot for university group management tools
Implemented user-facing workflows for managing members, preferences, and sync destinations, including optimistic UI updates to improve responsiveness
Developed REST APIs in Spring Boot using controller and service layers, and converted backend Grouper results into clean JSON responses for the UI
Used Swagger to test and verify API behavior while developing frontend service calls
Worked in a collaborative GitHub environment using branches, pull requests, and code reviews
Tested frontend and backend changes across success and error cases and contributed to internal technical documentation

work.company: University of Hawaiʻi Information Technology Services
work.summary: Worked on system correctness and reliability for an OCaml-based file system.
highlights: Analyzed and tested the correctness of an OCaml-based file system using Isabelle
Checked system rules to ensure file operations preserved data consistency
Reviewed block-level storage logic to prevent invalid states and data corruption
Identified edge cases early to improve overall system reliability

volunteer.summary: Digitized botanical specimen collections for research and public access.
highlights: Classified, cataloged, photographed, and digitized large collections of plant specimens
Created digital archives accessible to researchers and the public

volunteer.summary: Worked on robot control logic for autonomous and manual operation modes.
highlights: Implemented robot control logic for both autonomous and manual modes
Programmed time-based actions in autonomous mode, including movement and arm activation
Built configuration logic mapping user inputs to robot movement commands
Tested and debugged robot behavior to ensure reliable task execution
